TopicTitle: Minmus: TWR and dv to orbit?

Articles.Content:
How much i must have dv to go to orbit?

How big Thrust to Weight ratio must have my rocket to take off?

There is no such information on wiki.

I plan to convert from kethane and lift 150 tons of rocket parts to orbit and make ships out of it.

Edited August 28, 2013 by Dreamixpl

I don't think you looked very hard:

http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/Cheat_Sheet

http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/How_to_get_to_Minmus

http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/Minmus

Roughly 920m/s to transfer from Kerbin orbit, 80m/s for orbit insertion, 240m/s to land. Then 240m/s to take off into Minmus orbit, not much to break orbit and head back to Kerbin though.

Minmus has very low gravity so you don't need much thrust to take off again, TWR vs Minmus gravity needs to be above 1, you'd have to do the math or use engineer redux (or mechjeb) for the numbers.
Try using the Kerbal Engineer Redux mod. It gives you lots of info.
